positions.subtitle: Mercedes-Benz Research and Development India
positions.description: • Working on the modernization of TEO, a key component of the dialog application handling millions of requests per day, using core Java and microservices architecture to enhance system performance and reliability.• Developed and maintained REST APIs and microservices for the Dia4U project, resulting in up to 80%improvement in user efficiency.• Designed and implemented microservices and ETL processes, optimizing data handling workflows and reducing processing time by up to 60%.• Spearheaded the migration of Daily Jobs from Spark to Airflow using Python, improving ETL monitoring and execution reliability by up to 3x.• Reduced ETL execution time from 7 hours to 1.5 hours by implementing pivotal changes in microservices and ETL processes, achieving a 4x increase in processing efficiency.• Resolved complex customer queries, improving customer satisfaction and operational efficiency, resulting in a 30% increase in the customer base.• Tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, REST APIs, Cassandra, Spark, Kubernetes, Docker,Airflow, GitHub Actions, PostgreSQL, Azure, Kafka.
positions.title: Software Consultant
positions.description_html:
• Working on the modernization of TEO, a key component of the dialog application handling millions of requests per day, using core Java and microservices architecture to enhance system performance and reliability.
• Developed and maintained REST APIs and microservices for the Dia4U project, resulting in up to 80%
improvement in user efficiency.
• Designed and implemented microservices and ETL processes, optimizing data handling workflows and reducing processing time by up to 60%.
• Spearheaded the migration of Daily Jobs from Spark to Airflow using Python, improving ETL monitoring and execution reliability by up to 3x.
• Reduced ETL execution time from 7 hours to 1.5 hours by implementing pivotal changes in microservices and ETL processes, achieving a 4x increase in processing efficiency.
• Resolved complex customer queries, improving customer satisfaction and operational efficiency, resulting in a 30% increase in the customer base.
• Tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, REST APIs, Cassandra, Spark, Kubernetes, Docker,
Airflow, GitHub Actions, PostgreSQL, Azure, Kafka.

positions.subtitle: Mercedes-Benz Research and Development India
positions.description: • Contributed to the DIA4U Project by developing a PDM Reporting microservice, streamlining carline reports for business users.• Managed and resolved operational dependencies in microservices, incorporating API monitoring and alerts using Grafana.• Addressed and resolved customer queries, improving API performance and reliability.• Tech stack Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, Mockito, JUnit, Cassandra, Spark, Kubernetes, Docker,Grafana, Jenkins.
positions.title: Graduate Engineering Trainee
positions.description_html:
• Contributed to the DIA4U Project by developing a PDM Reporting microservice, streamlining carline reports for business users.
• Managed and resolved operational dependencies in microservices, incorporating API monitoring and alerts using Grafana.
• Addressed and resolved customer queries, improving API performance and reliability.
• Tech stack Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, Mockito, JUnit, Cassandra, Spark, Kubernetes, Docker,
Grafana, Jenkins.

educations_details: SDM College of Engg & Tech , Dharwad

education.title: SDM College of Engg & Tech , Dharwad

recommendations: Martin Štefanko “I mentored Sahil for his participation in Red Hat's Open Source contest, where he converted an application from the legacy framework Thorntail to Quarkus. Sahil had very little experience when he started, but he demonstrated enormous dedication and learned many different technologies from this experience. Except for Thorntail and Quarkus, he also studied Maven and Java. After the project, he was ready for a junior Java engineering position. Sahil is a dedicated software engineer who likes to learn new things and doesn't hesitate to take on even harder challenges.”
